text:
It later transpired that @EnvAgencyMids was not monitoring the air quality that weekend - despite repeated assurances they were - and did not send out any agents to "witness" the smell because they believed the unit to be operational. 
https://t.co/j0x1fjAqXi https://t.co/uYXAgSSKra

There was an increase of complaints about odour from the landfill in late 2020 and early 2021. 

In response, @EnvAgencyMids announced they would monitor the smell with an air quality monitoring unit. https://t.co/THS4xDvnfq

In October 2020, @EnvAgencyMids approved a permit application to increase to the amount of waste that can be disposed at the site from 250,000 tonnes to 400,000 tonnes per year.

https://t.co/t1dGnY7uvV
@DeTom48 @EnvAgencySE @AshfordCouncil @ADA_updates Burning the green waste is not as good as compost it ?

@StonebridgeLock @CanalRiverTrust @E17Wetlands @EnvAgency @sianberry Those are not bodged repair plates. They are plates put in place so that inexperienced or inattentive boaters don't get fenders snagged on the lock gate which cam and has sunk many boats. And it is inexperienced and inattentive boaters who do not shift fowl out during locking.
